The foliage has a pleasing texture and the bright colors last until autumn. Hardy and easy to care for, Red-hot Poker is perfect in sunny perennial beds, borders, and rock gardens. Its upright, bushy habit also makes it well suited for a container. Just water regularly and add a light dose of fertilizer for best performance. Make sure to cut the stems back in late winter or early spring for optimum growth and flowering. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4612,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Low","common_name":"Prairie junegrass","description":"Prairie junegrass (Koeleria macrantha) is a resilient, perennial, cool season grass that is native to North America. It is often found growing in prairies, pastures, savannas, and open woods. Its clump forming blue-gray foliage grows to 8-14 inches tall. During the springtime, the plant bears slender spikes of attractive, beige-white flowers. As a well-adapted xeric grass, it is drought tolerant, heat loving, and shade tolerant. It requires minimal care and has no known pests or diseases that affect it. Prairie junegrass is loved for its hardy nature, beauty, and versatility - making a great addition to lawns, meadows, and natural landscaping alike.","family":"Poaceae","flower_color":"Light green","flowering_season":null,"fruit_color":[],"growth_rate":"High","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":[],"maintenance":"Low","origin":["Europe","Asia","North America"],"other_name":[],"pest_susceptibility":[],"propagation":["Seed Propagation","Division","Cutting","Layering Propagation"],"pruning_month":["May"],"scientific_name":["Koeleria macrantha"],"soil":["Sandy Loamy Rocky"],"watering_period":null}}

{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4613,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Moderate","common_name":"golden rain tree","description":"The golden rain tree (Koelreuteria paniculata 'September') is an attractive, low-maintenance, deciduous shrub or small tree. Adaptable to a variety of soils, favorably growing in regions of full or partial sun. This round, spreading tree bears a canopy of feathery foliage that turns a beautiful golden yellow in fall. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4684,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"lantana","description":"Lantana (Lantana camara 'Ballucor' Little Lucky Orange) is an ornamental perennial shrub that produces small, fragrant, orange flowers year-round. It is incredibly low-maintenance, and its natural spreading habit makes it an ideal choice for ground cover, edging borders, and foundation plantings. It can grow up to 5 feet tall and can withstand temperatures as low as 10Â°F. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4758,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Moderate","common_name":"shasta daisy","description":"The Shasta Daisy (Leucanthemum superbum 'Aglaia') is a beautiful evergreen perennial with a large, heart-shaped basal rosette of foliage. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4633,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"crape myrtle","description":"Crape myrtle (Lagerstroemia 'Choctaw') is a deciduous species of flowering shrub growing up to 8 feet tall. It has attractive grey bark and bright red, orange, or white flowers when in bloom. Its dark green, glossy leaves provide contrasting beauty to its bright flowers. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4729,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"corkwood","description":"Corkwood (Leitneria floridana) is an evergreen shrub native to the southeastern United States. It grows up to 15 feet in height, and has attractive glossy foliage and fragrant, small, white flowers that bloom in spring. Its bark is very thick and corky and peels off in horizontal strips. It also produces many bright-red berries, which look like small crabapples, in autumn. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4754,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"shasta daisy","description":"The Shasta Daisy (Leucanthemum 'Macaroon') is a perennial flower that produces beautiful white petals with light yellow centers.
